item.title: An Iconic Marvel Character
item.dc:creator: ronrhino13
item.description:
One of my personal interests is superheroes. Not just costumes or powers or their books and movies but the characters motivation. The most relatable and iconic hero that I favor the most is Spider-Man. When I was a kid, I first saw a picture of him on a VHS Tape. Overtime, I learned more about …

An Iconic Marvel Character Read More »

The post An Iconic Marvel Character appeared first on My Portfolio.
item.content:encoded:
One of my personal interests is superheroes. Not just costumes or powers or their books and movies but the characters motivation. The most relatable and iconic hero that I favor the most is Spider-Man.

When I was a kid, I first saw a picture of him on a VHS Tape. Overtime, I learned more about him, what his motivations were as a hero, and how I relate to the personal struggles he goes through every day. One thing that came to mind was how did this character become such an icon for Marvel? In the 1960’s, Marvel comics had began their superhero age with the Fantastic Four, Daredevil, X-Men, and many more. It was co-creator Stan Lee that came up with the idea for Spider-Man after he saw a fly on the wall and though of different insect heroes.

When it came to Spider-Man, Stan decided to make his hero stand out from the rest as a teenager but publisher Martin Goodman felt that it wouldn’t be a good decision. Stan fought hard for his hero character and Goodman decided to publish the story in Amazing Fantasy comics issue 15. When it was released, the story of Spider-Man became one of the most popular and best selling comics at the time. Eventually, Marvel released Spider-Man’s first official comic in 1963.

Over the next 50 years, Spider-Man continues to inspire comic book readers and movie goers to learn that we have responsibilities within our lives and we have the power to take care of them.

The post An Iconic Marvel Character appeared first on My Portfolio.
